column1: What is MSSQL?
column2: Microsoft SQL (MSSQL) is Microsoft's SQL-based relational database management system that is closed source and initially written to run on Windows operating systems

column1: What is the default TCP port that MSSQL listens on?
column2: TCP port 1433

column1: What is SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)?
column2: A client-side application that comes as a feature with MSSQL install package or can be downloaded separately, commonly used for database configuration and management

column1: Name 5 MSSQL clients that can be used to access databases
column2: mssql-cli, SQL Server PowerShell, HeidiSQL, SQLPro, Impacket's mssqlclient.py

column1: What are the 5 default system databases in MSSQL?
column2: master, model, msdb, tempdb, resource

column1: What does the master database contain?
column2: Tracks all system information for an SQL server instance

column1: What does the model database do?
column2: Template database that acts as a structure for every new database created. Any setting changed in the model database will be reflected in any new database created after changes

column1: What is the msdb database used for?
column2: The SQL Server Agent uses this database to schedule jobs & alerts

column1: What does the tempdb database store?
column2: Stores temporary objects

column1: What is the resource database?
column2: Read-only database containing system objects included with SQL server

column1: What service does MSSQL likely run as when initially configured?
column2: NT SERVICE\MSSQLSERVER

column1: What authentication method is used by default in MSSQL?
column2: Windows Authentication

column1: Is encryption enforced by default when connecting to MSSQL?
column2: No, by default encryption is not enforced when attempting to connect

column1: What are 4 dangerous MSSQL settings to look for?
column2: MSSQL clients not using encryption, use of self-signed certificates, use of named pipes, weak & default sa credentials

column1: What command can you use to locate mssqlclient on your system?
column2: locate mssqlclient

column1: What NMAP scripts can be used to scan MSSQL services?
column2: ms-sql-info, ms-sql-empty-password, ms-sql-xp-cmdshell, ms-sql-config, ms-sql-ntlm-info, ms-sql-tables, ms-sql-hasdbaccess, ms-sql-dac, ms-sql-dump-hashes

column1: What Metasploit auxiliary scanner can be used for MSSQL footprinting?
column2: mssql_ping

column1: What is T-SQL?
column2: Transact-SQL, used to interact directly with databases through the SQL Database Engine

column1: How do you connect to MSSQL using Impacket's mssqlclient.py with Windows authentication?
column2: python3 mssqlclient.py Administrator@[IP] -windows-auth

column1: What SQL query lists all databases on an MSSQL server?
column2: select name from sys.databases

column1: What does DAC stand for in MSSQL context?
column2: Dedicated Administrator Connection

column1: What is the default DAC port in MSSQL?
What does the named pipe path look like in MSSQL?
column2: \\[servername]\pipe\sql\query
